Possible Values: 0 = Day, 1 = Good Till Cancel, 6 = Good till Date
Short Description, Compatibility Notes &: Specifies the maximum validity of a triggered stop order. On triggering of a Stop order the value in this field is populated in the field TimeInForce (59).
Numerical RFQ identifier assigned by the matching engine, unique per instrument and EMM.
Indicates whether the message is, or not, a quote sent as an answer to a QuoteRequest (R) message.
Indicates whether the message is, or not, an order sent as a confirmation of a QuoteRequest (R) message.
Indicates if the order is a conditional or a firm order
In this case provides the ExecutionWithinFirmShortCode

Possible Values: 3 = Client ID, 12 = Executing Trader, 999 = Not Applicable
Short Description, Compatibility Notes &: Identifies the type or role of the PartyID (448) specified.

Possible Values: 22 = Algorithm, 23 = Firm or legal entity, 24 = Natural person, 99 = Not Applicable
Short Description, Compatibility Notes &: Used to further qualify the value of PartyRole (452)

Possible Values: 5 = Order received from a direct access or sponsored access customer
Short Description, Compatibility Notes &: Identifies the origin of the order

Possible Values: 0 = Aggregated order, 1 = Pending allocation, 3 = Risk reduction order
Short Description, Compatibility Notes &: Used in case client needs to indicate values of AGGR or PNAL, OR in Risk Reduction order
Always set to Yes if OrderAttributeType (2594) if provided

Possible Values: 7 = Dealing on own account (DEAL), 8 = Matched principal (MTCH), 9 = Any other capacity (AOTC)
Short Description, Compatibility Notes &: Indicates whether the order submission results from trading as matched principal, on own account or as any other capacity.

Possible Values: Value '0' by default and depending to a minimum value for the given instrument and/or market type
Short Description, Compatibility Notes &: Minimum quantity to be executed upon order entry (else the order is rejected). Only provided when submitted in the original order entry message

Possible Values: 1 = Continuous Trading Phase, 2 = Call Phase, 3 = Halt Phase, 5 = Trading At Last Phase, 6 = Reserved, 7 = Suspended, 8 = Random Uncrossing Phase
Short Description, Compatibility Notes &: Indicates the trading phase during which the Matching Engine has received the order
